Footer.description: Your trusted NDIS support provider, delivering quality care services across Victoria.

Hero.title: NDIS Disability & Support Services Provider
Hero.subtitle: Welcome To Bright Support
Hero.description: Making navigating the NDIS easy with compassionate, professional support services tailored to your unique needs and goals.

response.title: 24-Hour Response
response.description: We respond to all enquiries within 24 hours, guaranteed.

sameDay.title: Same-Day Coordination
sameDay.description: Urgent support coordination available same day.

emergency.title: 24/7 Emergency Support
emergency.description: Call us anytime for emergency assistance.

Services.title: Our NDIS Services
Services.subtitle: Comprehensive disability support services designed to enhance your independence and quality of life.

communityNursing.title: Community Nursing & Complex Care
communityNursing.description: Professional nursing care including wound care, medication management, and chronic disease support delivered by qualified nurses in your home.

dailyLiving.title: Daily Living & In-Home Support
dailyLiving.description: Assistance with everyday activities to help you maintain independence at home, including personal care, meal preparation, and household tasks.

independentLiving.title: Independent Living & Accommodation Support
independentLiving.description: Support to live independently in your own home or supported accommodation, with assistance tailored to your needs.

communityParticipation.title: Community Participation & Group Programs
communityParticipation.description: Engaging programs to build social connections, develop skills, and participate in community activities.

physiotherapy.title: Physiotherapy Services
physiotherapy.description: Expert physiotherapy to improve mobility, manage pain, and enhance physical function with personalized treatment plans.

companionship.title: Companionship Services
companionship.description: Meaningful companionship and emotional support to reduce isolation and improve wellbeing through genuine connections.

transport.title: Travel & Transport Assistance
transport.description: Safe and reliable transport to appointments, activities, and community participation with trained support workers.

WhyChoose.title: Why Choose Bright Support?
WhyChoose.subtitle: We're committed to providing exceptional NDIS services that make a real difference in your life.

experienced.title: Experienced Team
experienced.description: Our skilled support workers are trained professionals dedicated to providing personalized care.

person.title: Person-Centered Approach
person.description: We focus on your individual goals and preferences to create tailored support plans.

available.title: Available When You Need Us
available.description: Flexible scheduling with support available when it suits you best.

registered.title: NDIS Registered
registered.description: Fully registered NDIS provider meeting all quality and safety standards.

Video.title: Learn More About Our Services
Video.subtitle: Watch our video to understand how we can support you

OurGoal.title: Our Goal Is To Make Your Life Better
OurGoal.subtitle: Providing exceptional support services with a person-centered approach

easy.title: We Make Navigating The NDIS Easy
easy.description: Our experienced team helps you understand and access NDIS services with ease. Available 24/7 through our hotline to support you whenever you need assistance.

support.title: Disabilities Support Services
support.description: Comprehensive, person-centered support services designed to help you live independently with dignity and choice. Our qualified team is dedicated to your goals and wellbeing.

CTA.title: Ready to Get Started?
CTA.description: Contact us today to discuss how we can help you achieve your NDIS goals.

meta.title: About Us | Bright Support - Our Story & Mission
meta.description: Learn about Bright Support's journey, mission, and values. Founded in 2019, we are a trusted NDIS service provider serving Shepparton and surrounding areas.

hero.title: About Bright Support
hero.subtitle: Your Trusted NDIS Partner
hero.description: Founded in 2019, Bright Support has grown from a small local provider to a trusted name in disability support services across Victoria.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.description: To empower individuals with disabilities to live their best lives through compassionate, person-centered support services that promote independence, choice, and community participation.

vision.title: Our Vision
vision.description: A world where every person with a disability has the opportunity to thrive, participate fully in their community, and achieve their personal goals.

compassion.title: Compassion
compassion.description: We approach every interaction with empathy and understanding.

integrity.title: Integrity
integrity.description: We are honest, transparent, and accountable in all we do.

excellence.title: Excellence
excellence.description: We strive for the highest quality in every service we provide.

respect.title: Respect
respect.description: We honor the dignity and worth of every individual.

team.title: Our Team
team.description: Our dedicated team of qualified support workers, nurses, and allied health professionals are passionate about making a difference in the lives of the people we support.

meta.title: Contact Us | Bright Support - Get in Touch
meta.description: Contact Bright Support for NDIS disability services. Call us at 1800 407 508 or visit our office in Shepparton.

hero.title: Contact Us
hero.subtitle: We're Here to Help
hero.description: Have questions about our services or want to discuss how we can support you? Get in touch with our friendly team today.

form.title: Send Us a Message
form.name: Full Name
form.success: Thank you! Your message has been sent successfully.
form.error: Sorry, there was an error sending your message. Please try again.

meta.title: Careers | Join Bright Support Team
meta.description: Looking for a rewarding career in disability support? Join Bright Support and make a difference. Competitive pay, flexible roles, and professional development opportunities.

hero.title: Join Our Team
hero.subtitle: Build a Rewarding Career
hero.description: Make a real difference in people's lives while growing your career in disability support services.

pay.title: Competitive Pay
pay.description: Above-award wages with penalty rates and allowances.

flexibility.title: Flexible Hours
flexibility.description: Choose shifts that work around your schedule and lifestyle.

training.title: Professional Development
training.description: Ongoing training and career advancement opportunities.

support.title: Supportive Team
support.description: Join a friendly, collaborative team that values your contribution.

impact.title: Make a Difference
impact.description: Meaningful work that positively impacts lives every day.

growth.title: Career Growth
growth.description: Clear pathways for advancement within the organization.

supportWorker.title: Support Worker
supportWorker.description: Provide direct support to NDIS participants in their homes and community.

nurse.title: Registered Nurse
nurse.description: Deliver complex care and nursing services to participants.

coordinator.title: Support Coordinator
coordinator.description: Help participants understand and implement their NDIS plans.

cta.title: Ready to Apply?
cta.description: Send your resume to our HR team and start your journey with Bright Support.

meta.title: Our Services | NDIS Support Services - Bright Support
meta.description: Comprehensive NDIS services including daily living support, community nursing, physiotherapy, community participation, personal training, hydrotherapy, and more.

hero.title: Our Services
hero.subtitle: Comprehensive NDIS Support
hero.description: We offer a wide range of NDIS-funded services designed to support your independence and help you achieve your goals.

ServicePage.ctaDescription: Contact us today to discuss how this service can support your NDIS goals.

dailyLiving.title: Daily Living & In-Home Support
dailyLiving.subtitle: Empowering Your Independence, One Day at a Time
dailyLiving.description: Your home is where you feel most comfortable, and that's exactly where we believe you should thrive. Our Daily Living & In-Home Support services are designed around YOU—your routines, your preferences, and your goals. Whether you need a helping hand with morning routines, someone to share a home-cooked meal with, or support mastering new skills for independent living, our friendly team is here to make every day a little easier and a lot more enjoyable.

images.hero: Friendly support worker helping participant prepare a healthy meal together in modern Australian kitchen, natural sunlight streaming through window, genuine smiles, warm lifestyle photography

gallery.prompt: Compassionate support worker assisting with personal care routine, respectful and dignified interaction, soft bathroom lighting
gallery.caption: Personal Care with Dignity

gallery.prompt: Support worker and participant doing light gardening together in sunny Australian backyard, planting flowers, teamwork and joy
gallery.caption: Enjoying the Outdoors Together

gallery.prompt: Person receiving help with grocery shopping, organized kitchen pantry, independence and choice
gallery.caption: Maintaining Your Independence

services: Meal planning, preparation, and cooking together

support247.title: Around-the-Clock Care
support247.description: From a few hours of support to 24/7 live-in care, we're here whenever you need us—day, night, or weekends.

qualified.title: Trusted & Trained Team
qualified.description: Every support worker is carefully screened, professionally trained, and matched to your personality and needs.

personCentered.title: Your Life, Your Way
personCentered.description: We don't just complete tasks—we work alongside you, respecting your choices and helping you achieve your goals.

flexible.title: Flexible & Reliable
flexible.description: Consistent support you can count on, with the flexibility to adjust as your life and needs change.

faq.question: What tasks can a support worker help me with at home?
faq.answer: Our support workers can assist with a wide range of daily tasks including personal care (showering, dressing, toileting), household tasks (cleaning, laundry, cooking), community access (shopping, appointments), and skill development. We work with you to create a personalized support plan based on your NDIS goals—no two plans are the same!

faq.question: Will I have the same support worker each time?
faq.answer: Consistency matters to us! We prioritize matching you with a small, dedicated team of regular support workers so you always see familiar, friendly faces. You'll have a primary worker and a reliable backup, and you can always request changes if the match doesn't feel right.

faq.question: Can you help me learn to do things independently?
faq.answer: Absolutely—that's our favorite kind of support! If your goal is to learn cooking, manage your household, or build other life skills, we'll teach, guide, and cheer you on at your own pace. It's about building YOUR confidence and capability.

communityNursing.title: Community Nursing & Complex Care
communityNursing.subtitle: Hospital-Quality Care in the Comfort of Home
communityNursing.description: Managing complex health needs doesn't mean you have to stay in a hospital. Our Community Nursing team brings expert clinical care directly to your doorstep. Led by experienced Registered Nurses, we provide specialized medical support, health assessments, and complex care management tailored to your specific condition—all while you relax in your own home, surrounded by the people and things you love.

images.hero: Professional registered nurse in uniform checking blood pressure of seated participant in comfortable living room, medical equipment visible, calm reassuring atmosphere, soft natural lighting

gallery.prompt: Nurse performing careful wound dressing change, close-up of gloved hands, clean medical setting, professional and gentle care
gallery.caption: Expert Wound Care Management

gallery.prompt: Nurse discussing medication schedule with participant using weekly pill organizer, educational moment, kitchen table setting
gallery.caption: Medication Support & Education

gallery.prompt: Nurse training family member on care procedures, supportive teaching moment, home environment
gallery.caption: Empowering Your Support Network

services: Complex wound management and dressing changes
PEG feeding and enteral nutrition support
Palliative and end-of-life care at home
Vital signs monitoring and health assessments
Training for family carers and support workers

registered.title: Expert Clinical Team
registered.description: All care delivered by AHPRA-registered Nurses with extensive acute and community experience.

available.title: 7-Day Availability
available.description: Consistent clinical support available weekends and public holidays—your health doesn't take days off.

coordinated.title: Integrated Healthcare
coordinated.description: We coordinate closely with your GP, specialists, and hospitals to ensure seamless, holistic care.

training.title: Carer Empowerment
training.description: We train your family and support network to confidently manage day-to-day health needs.

faq.question: Who provides the nursing care?
faq.answer: All clinical services are provided by our qualified Registered Nurses (RNs) and Enrolled Nurses (ENs) with current AHPRA registration. Each nurse has specialized experience in community and complex care settings, ensuring you receive hospital-quality care at home.

faq.question: Is community nursing covered by the NDIS?
faq.answer: Yes, if your plan includes 'CB Daily Activity' or 'Disability Related Health Supports'. We can help you check your funding and arrange the necessary assessments to secure nursing care funding.

faq.question: Can you train my family to help with my care?
faq.answer: Absolutely! Education is a key part of our service. We can train you, your family, or your support workers on correct procedures for medications, manual handling, wound care, and more—giving everyone confidence and peace of mind.

physiotherapy.title: Physiotherapy Services
physiotherapy.subtitle: Restoring Movement, Enhancing Life
physiotherapy.description: Movement is freedom. Our Physiotherapy services are dedicated to helping you maximize your physical potential, reduce pain, and improve your daily function. Whether you live with a neurological condition, are recovering from surgery, or want to improve your balance and strength, our experienced Physiotherapists design personalized programs around what YOU want to achieve—making therapy meaningful and motivating.

images.hero: Professional physiotherapist guiding participant through mobility exercises in bright therapy room, resistance bands, genuine encouragement, healthcare photography

gallery.prompt: Physio helping with balance training using stability equipment, focus and concentration, modern clinic setting
gallery.caption: Balance & Coordination Training

gallery.prompt: Physiotherapist demonstrating home exercises in living room, exercise mat, practical skill transfer
gallery.caption: Home Exercise Programs

gallery.prompt: Person using mobility equipment prescribed by physiotherapist, walker or wheelchair, outdoor setting, independence
gallery.caption: Equipment & Mobility Solutions

qualified.title: Experienced Physios
qualified.description: Our AHPRA-registered Physiotherapists have specialized expertise in disability and neurological rehabilitation.

homeVisits.title: We Come to You
homeVisits.description: Therapy in your own home, gym, or pool—wherever it's most convenient and effective for you.

personalized.title: Goal-Directed Therapy
personalized.description: We build your program around what YOU want to achieve—walking to the shops, playing with grandkids, returning to work.

equipment.title: Assistive Technology
equipment.description: Expert advice on wheelchairs, walkers, and mobility equipment with trials and NDIS report writing.

faq.question: Is physiotherapy covered by NDIS?
faq.answer: Yes, physiotherapy falls under 'Improved Daily Living' (Capacity Building) within the NDIS. We can help you understand your plan's funding categories and make the most of your allocation.

faq.question: Do I need a referral to see a physiotherapist?
faq.answer: No referral is needed for NDIS participants. We'll conduct an initial assessment to understand your history, goals, and create a personalized treatment plan.

faq.question: Can you help me choose the right wheelchair or walker?
faq.answer: Absolutely! Our physios are skilled in Assistive Technology prescription. We organize trials, write NDIS reports, and ensure equipment is perfectly set up for your needs.

communityParticipation.title: Community Participation & Group Programs
communityParticipation.subtitle: Connect, Belong, and Thrive Together
communityParticipation.description: Life is better shared! Our Community Participation programs are all about building genuine connections, discovering new passions, and being an active, valued member of your community. Whether you want to join a cooking class, try your hand at art, attend local events, or simply catch up for coffee with new friends, we make it happen. Our supported group activities are designed to be safe, inclusive, and—most importantly—fun!

images.hero: Diverse group of people laughing and enjoying outdoor picnic in sunny Australian park, genuine friendship, vibrant colors, lifestyle photography

gallery.prompt: Participants engaged in creative art workshop, colorful canvases, paintbrushes, joyful expression
gallery.caption: Discover Your Creative Side

gallery.prompt: Mixed ability sports group playing lawn games in park, teamwork, cheering, community spirit
gallery.caption: Active & Social Fun

gallery.prompt: Group cooking class with participants preparing food together, shared laughter, learning new skills
gallery.caption: Learning Together

variety.title: Something for Everyone
variety.description: A diverse calendar of activities catering to different ages, interests, and abilities.

inclusive.title: Fully Inclusive
inclusive.description: We ensure all venues and activities are accessible and welcoming for everyone.

skills.title: Learning Through Fun
skills.description: Develop communication, teamwork, and independence skills in a natural social setting.

connections.title: Real Friendships
connections.description: Meet like-minded people and build a supportive social network in your local area.

faq.question: Can I suggest an activity or program?
faq.answer: Absolutely! Our programs are participant-led. If there's something you've always wanted to try—pottery, fishing, dancing—just let us know and we can look at organizing it!

faq.question: Is transport included in group programs?
faq.answer: We often use our accessible vehicles for group outings and can pick you up from home or a central meeting point. Transport arrangements depend on the specific activity.

faq.question: Can I bring a friend who isn't an NDIS participant?
faq.answer: Of course! Friends and family are welcome to join many activities as guests. If your friend is also an NDIS participant, they can join as a full participant.

companionship.title: Companionship & Social Support
companionship.subtitle: Meaningful Connections, Genuine Care
companionship.description: Loneliness shouldn't be a part of anyone's life. Our Companionship services are about more than just having someone in the room—they're about sharing life's moments with a friend. Whether you enjoy a quiet chat over tea, need a partner for your hobbies, or want someone to accompany you to a show, our companions are here to brighten your day and support your wellbeing.

images.hero: Two people sharing warm conversation over tea at cozy cafe table, genuine smiles, soft lighting, friendship and connection

gallery.prompt: Companion and participant playing board game together at dining table, focused engagement, having fun
gallery.caption: Shared Hobbies & Interests

gallery.prompt: Two people walking together in local park, gentle exercise, conversation, morning light
gallery.caption: Staying Active Together

gallery.prompt: Companion helping participant use tablet to video call family, technology connection, support
gallery.caption: Staying Connected

services: Friendly home visits for conversation and company
Accompanying to social events and family gatherings
Participating in shared hobbies (gardening, crafts, games)
Support with technology to stay connected with loved ones
Library visits, movies, and cultural outings
Emotional support and a listening ear

matched.title: Perfectly Matched
matched.description: We consider personality, language, and interests to find the right companion for YOU.

flexible.title: Here When Needed
flexible.description: Available for a few hours a week or daily visits, tailored to your social needs.

trained.title: More Than a Friend
trained.description: Our companions are trained support workers who can also assist with basic needs if required.

meaningful.title: Emotional Wellbeing
meaningful.description: Regular social interaction improves mental health, reduces isolation, and enhances quality of life.

faq.question: What if my companion and I don't click?
faq.answer: Chemistry is important! If you don't feel a connection with your companion, just let us know. We'll happily arrange meet-and-greets to find someone you truly get along with.

faq.question: Can my companion take me places?
faq.answer: Yes! If your plan includes transport, your companion can pick you up and take you to cafes, events, appointments, or anywhere you'd like to go.

faq.question: Is companionship different from personal care support?
faq.answer: Yes. While our companions are trained in support work, the primary focus is social interaction and emotional wellbeing. It's about 'being with' rather than 'doing for'—though we can help with light tasks too.

transport.title: Travel & Transport Assistance
transport.subtitle: Getting You Where Life Takes You
transport.description: Don't let transport be a barrier to living your life. Our Travel & Transport Assistance ensures you can get from A to B safely, reliably, and comfortably. Whether it's a critical medical appointment, a weekly grocery shop, or a trip to catch up with friends, our friendly support workers are ready to help. We provide more than just a ride—we offer door-to-door support, helping you into the vehicle and accompanying you to your destination if needed.

images.hero: Friendly driver helping participant into modern accessible vehicle with wheelchair ramp, welcoming smile, suburban setting, safe transport

gallery.prompt: Participant arriving at medical center with support worker, door-to-door service, professional assistance
gallery.caption: Reliable Medical Transport

gallery.prompt: Person exiting vehicle at shopping center with shopping bags, independence, community engagement
gallery.caption: Community Access Made Easy

gallery.prompt: Support worker and participant traveling together, conversation in vehicle, comfortable journey
gallery.caption: Supported Travel

services: Transport to medical and specialist appointments
Travel training for public transport confidence
Door-to-door assistance getting in and out

reliable.title: On Time, Every Time
reliable.description: We understand punctuality matters, especially for appointments. You can count on us.

accessible.title: Accessible Fleet
accessible.description: Our vehicles include wheelchair accessible options with hoists and ramps.

trained.title: Supportive Drivers
trained.description: All drivers are trained support workers who can assist you throughout the journey.

flexible.title: Flexible Booking
flexible.description: Regular recurring trips or one-off bookings—whatever works for you.

faq.question: Can I use my own car?
faq.answer: Yes! If you prefer, a support worker can drive your vehicle, provided it is comprehensively insured and roadworthy.

faq.question: How does billing work for transport?
faq.answer: We charge per kilometer for vehicle usage plus the support worker's time, in line with NDIS Price Guide limits. We'll explain all costs upfront.

faq.question: Can someone stay with me at my appointment?
faq.answer: Absolutely! If you wish, your support worker can stay with you during appointments to offer support and help communicate your needs.

hydrotherapy.title: Hydrotherapy & Pool Sessions
hydrotherapy.subtitle: Healing Through the Power of Water
hydrotherapy.description: Discover the therapeutic magic of water. Our Hydrotherapy sessions utilize warm water to relax muscles, support body weight, and reduce pain—making movement easier and more effective. Led by qualified professionals, these sessions are perfect for rehabilitation, improving circulation, and building strength without the impact of land-based exercise. It's a gentle yet powerful way to achieve your physical therapy goals in a soothing environment.

images.hero: Therapist and participant doing gentle exercises in warm hydrotherapy pool, water at chest height, calming blue water, rehabilitation focus

gallery.prompt: Group aquatic exercise class in heated pool, foam noodles, smiling participants, inclusive fitness
gallery.caption: Fun Group Sessions

gallery.prompt: Accessible hydrotherapy pool facility with hoist and ramp, modern clean environment, therapeutic setting
gallery.caption: Fully Accessible Facilities

gallery.prompt: Participant relaxing in warm water after exercise, peaceful expression, stress relief
gallery.caption: Relaxation & Recovery

warm.title: Therapeutic Warmth
warm.description: Sessions in heated pools (32-34°C) to relax muscles and ease joint pain.

qualified.title: Expert Guidance
qualified.description: Sessions led by Physiotherapists or Exercise Physiologists for safety and results.

individual.title: Custom Programs
individual.description: Exercises tailored specifically to your condition and physical abilities.

progress.title: Low Impact, High Results
progress.description: Reduce stress on joints while building muscle strength and endurance.

faq.question: Do I need to be able to swim?
faq.answer: Not at all! Most hydrotherapy exercises are done standing in chest-deep water with full support from your therapist. You don't need to be a swimmer to benefit.

faq.question: What should I wear to hydrotherapy?
faq.answer: Standard swimwear is fine. Some people prefer wearing a rash vest for extra warmth or coverage. We can discuss appropriate attire before your first session.

faq.question: Is the pool facility accessible?
faq.answer: Yes! We use facilities with hoist access, ramps, and accessible changing rooms to ensure everyone can participate safely and comfortably.

personalTraining.title: Personal Training Sessions
personalTraining.subtitle: Fitness for Everybody and Every Body
personalTraining.description: Fitness is a journey, and we're here to walk (or run!) it with you. Our Personal Training services are inclusive, adaptive, and designed to help you feel your best. Whether you want to build muscle, improve your cardiovascular health, or simply have fun moving your body, our qualified trainers create safe programs adapted to YOUR abilities. We believe exercise promotes not just physical strength, but mental resilience and confidence too.

images.hero: Energetic personal trainer high-fiving participant after completing exercise set, gym equipment, achievement and celebration, dynamic lighting

gallery.prompt: Trainer guiding participant through safe dumbbell exercise, correct form, encouraging atmosphere, modern gym
gallery.caption: Strength Training Made Accessible

gallery.prompt: Outdoor personal training session in park, bodyweight exercises, fresh air, smiles and energy
gallery.caption: Train Anywhere

gallery.prompt: Adaptive fitness equipment being used with trainer support, wheelchair user exercising, inclusive fitness
gallery.caption: Fitness for Every Ability

qualified.title: Adaptive Experts
qualified.description: Trainers qualified in disability fitness who know how to adapt exercises safely.

personalized.title: Tailored to You
personalized.description: No cookie-cutter programs. Every workout is designed around your specific goals and capacity.

location.title: Train Anywhere
location.description: We can meet you at a local gym, a park, or even in your own living room.

safe.title: Health First
safe.description: We prioritize correct technique and safety to prevent injury and maximize results.

faq.question: I've never been to a gym before. Is that okay?
faq.answer: Absolutely! Everyone starts somewhere. We'll introduce you to equipment slowly and help you feel comfortable and confident in the gym environment.

faq.question: Do I need medical clearance to start training?
faq.answer: Depending on your condition, we may recommend a clearance from your GP or Physio to ensure we prescribe safe exercises for you.

faq.question: Can I train with a friend or partner?
faq.answer: Yes! Training with a buddy can be great motivation. Ask us about small group sessions or partner training options.

behaviourSupport.title: Positive Behaviour Support
behaviourSupport.subtitle: Understanding, Not Judging
behaviourSupport.description: Behind every behaviour is a need trying to be communicated. Our Positive Behaviour Support (PBS) service works to understand the 'why' behind behaviours of concern and develops evidence-based strategies to improve quality of life—for the participant AND their support network. We take a compassionate, person-centered approach, focusing on skill-building, environmental modifications, and reducing the need for restrictive practices.

images.hero: Behaviour support practitioner in calm, supportive discussion with participant and family member, comfortable office setting, understanding and collaboration

gallery.prompt: Professional writing behaviour support plan at desk, documents and laptop, thoughtful and detail-oriented approach
gallery.caption: Comprehensive Assessments

gallery.prompt: Practitioner training support workers on de-escalation strategies, group learning session, whiteboard
gallery.caption: Training & Support

gallery.prompt: Person engaging in calming activity with sensory tools, peaceful environment, self-regulation
gallery.caption: Skill Building & Strategies

qualified.title: Registered PBS Practitioners
qualified.description: NDIS-registered practitioners with specialized qualifications in complex behaviour.

evidenceBased.title: Evidence-Based Practice
evidenceBased.description: Strategies grounded in Applied Behaviour Analysis (ABA) and contemporary PBS research.

personCentered.title: Dignity & Respect
personCentered.description: We see the person first, working with them to improve their quality of life.

collaborative.title: Whole-Team Approach
collaborative.description: We work closely with families, support workers, therapists, and educators.

faq.question: What does a PBS Practitioner actually do?
faq.answer: PBS Practitioners assess why behaviours are occurring, write comprehensive support plans with evidence-based strategies, train everyone working with you (or your loved one) on how to implement the plan, and monitor progress regularly.

faq.question: Will you work with my other therapists?
faq.answer: Absolutely. Behaviour is often linked to communication, sensory needs, and health. We actively collaborate with Speech Pathologists, OTs, Psychologists, and Nurses to ensure a holistic approach.

faq.question: Is PBS just for children?
faq.answer: Not at all. Positive Behaviour Support is effective for people of all ages, including adults with intellectual disabilities, autism, acquired brain injury, or mental health conditions.

cleaning.title: Professional Cleaning Services
cleaning.subtitle: A Clean Home, A Clear Mind
cleaning.description: A tidy home isn't a luxury—it's essential for health, comfort, and peace of mind. Our Professional Cleaning services help you maintain a spotless living space without the stress. Whether it's a weekly surface clean, a deep bathroom scrub, or help organizing your space, our friendly cleaners work to YOUR standards and preferences. Sit back, relax, and enjoy coming home to a fresh, clean space.

images.hero: Professional cleaner vacuuming in bright, organized living room, clean surfaces, professional and friendly service

gallery.prompt: Cleaner wiping down kitchen counters with sparkling result, attention to detail, organized space
gallery.caption: Spotless Kitchens

gallery.prompt: Fresh clean bathroom with folded towels, hygienic and sparkling, professional result
gallery.caption: Hygienic Bathrooms

gallery.prompt: Organized wardrobe and bedroom space, decluttered, peaceful home environment
gallery.caption: Organized Spaces

services: Deep spring cleaning and move-out cleans

reliable.title: Same Team, Same Standard
reliable.description: Consistent cleaners who learn your preferences for a personalized service.

trained.title: Respectful & Trained
trained.description: All staff trained in respectful, client-centered service delivery.

flexible.title: Fits Your Schedule
flexible.description: Choose your preferred day, time, and frequency—we work around you.

products.title: Safe Products
products.description: Eco-friendly and hypoallergenic options available for sensitivities.

faq.question: Do you bring cleaning supplies?
faq.answer: We can provide all cleaning supplies and equipment, or use products you already have at home if you prefer. Just let us know!

faq.question: Can the same person clean my home each time?
faq.answer: Absolutely. We know consistency matters. We'll assign a regular cleaner (with a backup) who will get to know your home and preferences.

faq.question: Do I need to be home during cleaning?
faq.answer: That's completely up to you. Many clients provide a key or safe access code. Others prefer to be home—whatever makes you comfortable.

independentLiving.title: Independent Living & Accommodation Support
independentLiving.subtitle: Your Home, Your Rules, Our Support
independentLiving.description: Everyone deserves a place to call home. Our Independent Living & Accommodation Support services—including Supported Independent Living (SIL)—help you live in a home of your choosing with the level of support that's right for you. Whether you need 24-hour assistance, overnight support, or just a few hours a day to help with household tasks and skill-building, we're here to help you achieve your living goals.

images.hero: Modern accessible apartment interior, person cooking in adaptive kitchen, independence, bright and welcoming space

gallery.prompt: Exterior of well-maintained supported living house, accessible entrance, welcoming Australian suburban setting
gallery.caption: Quality SIL Homes

gallery.prompt: Participant learning budgeting skills with support worker, laptop and documents, skill building session
gallery.caption: Life Skills Development

gallery.prompt: Housemates enjoying meal together in shared living space, friendship and community, independence
gallery.caption: Community & Friendship

services: Transition support from family home or other accommodation

personCentered.title: You Choose Your Home
personCentered.description: We support you to find accommodation that fits your lifestyle, preferences, and location.

skillBuilding.title: Build Independence
skillBuilding.description: We actively teach skills so you can do more for yourself over time.

flexible.title: Flexible Support Levels
flexible.description: From a few hours of drop-in support to 24/7 overnight care—tailored to your needs.

quality.title: Quality Accommodation
quality.description: Modern, comfortable homes meeting SDA specifications where applicable.

accessible.title: Accessible Design
accessible.description: Housing options with accessibility features for mobility, sensory, and other needs.

faq.question: What is SIL and how do I get it?
faq.answer: Supported Independent Living (SIL) is NDIS funding for daily personal activities support in a shared living arrangement. To access SIL, you'll need an NDIS assessment and 'reasonable and necessary' determination. We can help guide you through the process.

faq.question: Can I live on my own or do I have to share?
faq.answer: Both options are available! Some people prefer living solo with drop-in support, while others enjoy the companionship of shared accommodation. We work with you to find the right fit.

faq.question: What if I don't get along with my housemates?
faq.answer: We take housemate matching seriously. Before anyone moves in, we facilitate meetings to ensure compatibility. If issues arise, we work with everyone to resolve them or find alternative arrangements.
